body:
### Problem

Nvim crashes on cmdline completion in some cases after disabling extui when cmdheight=0. 

Backtrace:
```cpp
#0  0x000055c29f8f99cc in pum_display (array=0x55c2d92b2480, size=<optimized out>, selected=-1, array_changed=true, cmd_startcol=1) at .../src/nvim/popupmenu.c:176
176           pum_anchor_grid = target_win->w_grid.target->handle;
(gdb) bt
#0  0x000055c29f8f99cc in pum_display (array=0x55c2d92b2480, size=<optimized out>, selected=-1, array_changed=true, cmd_startcol=1) at .../src/nvim/popupmenu.c:176
#1  0x000055c29f720e45 in cmdline_pum_display (changed_array=true) at .../src/nvim/cmdexpand.c:414
#2  cmdline_pum_create (ccline=0x55c29fcbe600 <ccline.lto_priv>, xp=<optimized out>, matches=<optimized out>, numMatches=<optimized out>, showtail=<optimized out>) at .../src/nvim/cmdexpand.c:409
#3  showmatches (xp=<optimized out>, wildmenu=<optimized out>) at .../src/nvim/cmdexpand.c:1126
#4  0x000055c29f7e0190 in command_line_wildchar_complete (s=0x7ffd86170810) at .../src/nvim/ex_getln.c:1195
#5  command_line_execute (state=0x7ffd86170810, key=<optimized out>) at .../src/nvim/ex_getln.c:1452
#6  0x000055c29f97a606 in state_enter (s=0x7ffd86170810) at .../src/nvim/state.c:100
#7  0x000055c29f7d8ab1 in command_line_enter (firstc=<optimized out>, count=<optimized out>, indent=<optimized out>, clear_ccline=<optimized out>) at .../src/nvim/ex_getln.c:896
#8  0x000055c29f7c1fcb in do_cmdline (cmdline=<optimized out>, fgetline=0x55c29f7dafa0 <getexline>, cookie=<optimized out>, flags=<optimized out>) at .../src/nvim/ex_docmd.c:587
#9  0x000055c29f8b0dcf in nv_colon (cap=0x7ffd86171460) at .../src/nvim/normal.c:3188
#10 0x000055c29f8ae062 in normal_execute (state=0x7ffd861713f0, key=<optimized out>) at .../src/nvim/normal.c:1244
#11 0x000055c29f97a606 in state_enter (s=0x7ffd861713f0) at .../src/nvim/state.c:100
#12 0x000055c29f8ab601 in normal_enter (cmdwin=<optimized out>, noexmode=<optimized out>) at .../src/nvim/normal.c:521
#13 0x000055c29f6ba79d in main (argc=<optimized out>, argv=<optimized out>) at .../src/nvim/main.c:653
```

I'm not sure how much attention is worth paying to it when #35117 is in progress. 

### Steps to reproduce

I can reproduce that only for some `lines` amount (e.g. 17). Try to change terminal height while cannot reproduce. Then try:
- `nvim --clean --cmd 'set cmdheight=0' --cmd "lua require('vim._extui').enable({enable = true})"`
- inside `:lua require('vim._extui').enable({enable = false})`
- try to complete anything from cmdline `:<Tab>` (if no crash happened, try to increase the terminal height)

### Expected behavior

No crash

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

v0.12.0-dev-1123+g3c601d02dc

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

n/a

### Operating system/version

Debian Sid

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.42.1, tmux inside alacritty

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty, tmux-256color respectively

### Installation

build from repo

comment_data.body:
> What is the crash message?

Outside of `bt` output I found also `SIGFPE, Arithmetic exception` (no `--clean` in that execution trace, but it rather does not matter here):
```
Reading symbols from .../bin/nvim...

warning: Can't open file anon_inode:[io_uring] during file-backed mapping note processing
[New LWP 352043]
[Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled]
Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1".
Core was generated by `.../bin/nvim --embed --cmd set\ cmdheight=0 --cmd lua\ require\(\'vim._extui\'\).enable\(\{enable\ =\ true\}\)'.
Program terminated with signal SIGFPE, Arithmetic exception.
#0  pum_display (array=0x55b8a3c0cec0, size=<optimized out>, selected=-1, array_changed=true, cmd_startcol=1) at .../src/nvim/popupmenu.c:162
162           cursor_col %= cmdline_win ? cmdline_win->w_view_width : Columns;
```
Hmm, the crash happens on a different line in this case?

I don't know what it depends on. Now the header (of `coredumpctl debug`) shows me line 176 and no `Arithmetic exception`. ``` Reading symbols from .../bin/nvim... warning: Can't open file anon_inode:[io_uring] during file-backed mapping note processing [New LWP 354556] [Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled] Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1". Core was generated by `.../bin/nvim --embed --cmd lua\ require\(\'vim._extui\'\).enable\(\{enable\ =\ true\}\)'. Program terminated with signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault. #0 0x000056441a2189cc in pum_display (array=0x56442fd33cc0, size=, selected=-1, array_changed=true, cmd_startcol=1) at .../src/nvim/popupmenu.c:176 176 pum_anchor_grid = target_win->w_grid.target->handle; ``` The recent crashes come only from the instance mentioned in the initial post. Maybe I can find a separate trace for line 162. In case when the terminal height does not reveal crash, popupmenu seems to be placed incorrectly: On crash

For the record, here is bt from 352043:
```cpp
#0  pum_display (array=0x55b8a3c0cec0, size=<optimized out>, selected=-1, array_changed=true, cmd_startcol=1) at .../src/nvim/popupmenu.c:162

#8  0x000055b89f36cfcb in do_cmdline (cmdline=<optimized out>, fgetline=0x55b89f385fa0 <getexline>, cookie=<optimized out>, flags=<optimized out>) at .../src/nvim/ex_docmd.c:587
#9  0x000055b89f45bdcf in nv_colon (cap=0x7fff51652880) at .../src/nvim/normal.c:3188
#10 0x000055b89f459062 in normal_execute (state=0x7fff51652810, key=<optimized out>) at .../src/nvim/normal.c:1244
#11 0x000055b89f525606 in state_enter (s=0x7fff51652810) at .../src/nvim/state.c:100
#12 0x000055b89f456601 in normal_enter (cmdwin=<optimized out>, noexmode=<optimized out>) at .../src/nvim/normal.c:521
#13 0x000055b89f26579d in main (argc=<optimized out>, argv=<optimized out>) at .../src/nvim/main.c:653
```

I performed the same steps four times manually and got either the first or the second backtrace 
```
Mon 2025-09-01 16:39:23 CEST  359589 1000 1000 SIGSEGV present      .../bin/nvim             593.3K
Mon 2025-09-01 16:39:50 CEST  359708 1000 1000 SIGFPE  present      .../bin/nvim             590.7K
Mon 2025-09-01 16:40:13 CEST  359755 1000 1000 SIGSEGV present      .../bin/nvim             587.8K
Mon 2025-09-01 16:40:44 CEST  359819 1000 1000 SIGFPE  present      .../bin/nvim             591.4K
```

With that patch I get crash `...double free or corruption (out)`

At the moment I haven't caught any case when the terminal width can matter. I'll let you know if I get such difference reproducible at least for me.

Still don't know what it depends on, but alternately (not strictly one by one) with the above I get arithmetic exception mentioned above:

Confirmed. Thank you!

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

labels.description: Nvim 0.12 mesages/dialog/pager/notifications based on the UI-ext protocol
labels.name: ui2

title: cmdexpand: crash on pum_display after disable extui with ch=0
